This will eventually be a wonderfully-elucidating article on integrating tooltips into Vega-Lite renderings.

For now, it is a way to test if things are working or not.

Let's start out with a basic chart:

```{r basic-chart}
library("altair")

plot_basic <-
  alt$Chart(
    r_to_py(mtcars)
  )$encode(
    x = "mpg:Q",
    y = "hp:Q",
    color = "cyl:N"
  )$mark_point()

vegalite(plot_basic, height = 400)
```

```{r toolip-basic}
vegalite(plot_basic, tooltip = vega_tooltip_encoding(), height = 400)
```

```{r tooltip-all}
vegalite(plot_basic, tooltip = vega_tooltip_all(), height = 400)
```

```{r tooltip-composition}
tooltip_custom <- 
  vega_tooltip() %>%
  add_field(field = "mpg", title = "MPG") %>%
  add_field(field = "hp", title = "HP")

examine(tooltip_custom)
```

```{r tooltip-test}
vegalite(plot_basic, tooltip = tooltip_custom, height = 400)
```
